bill_title: revise certain provisions relating to the James River Water Development District.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create the North Central Water Development District, to provide for the appointment of the board of directors, to establish certain property tax levy limitations, and to revise the boundaries of the James River Water Development District. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 46A-3A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The North Central Water Development District is hereby established. The North Central Water Development District includes all of Brown, Marshall, and Spink counties. Section 2. That § 46A-3A-4 be amended to read as follows: 46A-3A-4. The James River Water Development District is hereby established. The James River Water Development District includes all of Brown, Spink, Beadle, Sanborn, Davison, Hand, Hanson, Hutchinson, Marshall, and Yankton counties; Farmington, Homer, Independence, Andover, Union, Lynn, Bristol, Kidder, Scotland, Valley, Butler, Oak, Troy, and York townships in Day County; Redstone, Carthage, Miner, Green Valley, Clinton, Roswell, Beaver, and Rock Creek townships in Miner County; and Pleasant Valley, Bristol, Belford, Cooper, Firesteel, Palatine, Plankinton, Hopper, Pleasant Lake, Dudley, and Aurora townships in Aurora County. Section 3. That chapter 46A-3A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of § 46A-3A-1, the North Central Water Development District shall exist as a legal entity beginning on July 1, 2012. For the property taxes payable in 2012 which were imposed by the James River Water Development District in Brown, Marshall, and Spink counties, fifty percent of such property taxes shall be disbursed to the James River Water Development District and fifty percent shall be disbursed to the North Central Water Development District. Section 4. That chapter 46A-3B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapter 46A-3B, the North Central Water Development District board of directors shall be appointed by the board of county commissioners and the board shall consist of three members. Each board of county commissioners may appoint one person to serve on the water development district board of directors at their first meeting in July. The initial directors shall be appointed to serve staggered terms with the Brown County appointee serving one year, the Marshall County appointee serving two years, and the Spink County appointee serving three years. The directors shall thereafter be appointed for three-year terms at each subsequent appointment to succeed those directors whose terms expire. Section 5. That chapter 46A-3E be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapter 46A-3E, the North Central Water Development District board of directors may levy taxes, not to exceed ten and four tenth cents per thousand dollars of taxable valuation in the district for property taxes payable in 2013 and 2014. The water development district may adjust the maximum amount of revenue payable for property taxes based on the growth and index factor for each year thereafter pursuant to chapter 10-13.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to the James River Water Development District. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Legislature may dissolve the James River Water Development District. 180 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.063 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to the James River Water Development District. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Legislature may dissolve the James River Water Development District and may create the James Basin Water Development District. 180 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.063 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
